Abkhan.description: Large biological bleedwalker that protects its nest
Abkhan.flavor: If this monster had wings we might have called it a dragon. It lurked in hostile environments, greedily hoarding precious resources. It even had the breath of a dragon, only it burned its victims with ice instead of fire. If you killed one, you didn’t linger near its lair—rumors had it that, days after death, the beast would rise again.
Abkhan.name: Abkhan

Abkluths.description: Biological melee bleedwalkers that regenerate hitpoints each turn
Abkluths.flavor: The Acrin's creatures—pets or food, I never knew. But they got loose from the wreckage of the crash site and made themselves at home here. We couldn't eat them—fundamentally different biologies I hear—but if you didn't hunt them, they'd kill or shred everything that you could eat.
Abkluths.name: Abkluths

Abkluth Dragoons.description: Biological melee bleedwalkers that can take control of enemy Abkluth
Abkluth Dragoons.flavor: When they crashed, the Acrin brought creatures with them—monstrous lizardthings, tearing Earth wildlife apart. Given their docility around the Acrin, I suspect they were meant for pets or food, but that didn't stop the Voice Cults using them for war.
Abkluth Dragoons.name: Abkluth Dragoons

Acrin Remnants.description: Biological bleedwalkers with strong healing powers and the ability to conjure Bleed
Acrin Remnants.flavor: Acrin survivors used the whispers of the Voice to keep their people alive on a broken planet. When drafted into battle, every one of them was capable of regenerating a broken body. They were skilled at tearing them apart too.
Acrin Remnants.name: Acrin Remnants

Acrin Titan.description: Biological titan that can pull enemies into its causal well and devour them
Acrin Titan.flavor: I can close my eyes and block out the Titan's limbs, the flesh, the mouth running down the center of its torso but it's the goddamn smell that won't go away. It sounds crazy but it smelled like… like breaking bones. Like your leg twisting all the way around, your foot turned backwards, your arm crushed by a boulder. It didn't smell like the pain or the blood, just the sensation of looking at your own body and seeing how wrong it was.
Acrin Titan.name: Acrin Titan

Acrin Zealot.description: Biological bleedwalkers with crippling melee weapons and the ability to teleport between Bleed tiles
Acrin Zealot.flavor: Pity the grunts. One day, they learned about the Zealots—Acrin who could walk into one patch of Bleed tendrils and emerge from another. Next thing, every Bleed hub had a bunch of idiot soldiers hunkered outside it. Like the Acrin were just going to walk into their bullets. Jesus, where do we find these people?
Acrin Zealot.name: Acrin Zealot

Aegyllan Worms.description: Biological short-range anti-armor infantry that can move underground
Aegyllan Worms.flavor: Hearing the Voice didn't change everyone the same. Some kept looking for that dark, quiet place, came back changed to find it, delving into the black depths of the Earth. To see a friend's face on one of these, dragging itself out of stone and dirt, that was hard.
Aegyllan Worms.name: Aegyllan Worms

Akavish Provost.description: Large mechanical agile vehicle that taunts enemies and manipulates incoming damage
Akavish Provost.flavor: The first Provost was supposedly a fluke; an advanced intelligence core that malfunctioned and demanded a cradle to carry it into battle—screaming that “The Fall of Babylon was nigh.” But I don't think it malfunctioned. I think something was waiting in its code, something its creators didn't put in there. The machines were just as eager as the Voice cultists to see what the end of days looked like.
Akavish Provost.name: Akavish Provost

Aranean Stalkers.description: Mechanical sniper infantry that can mark targets
Aranean Stalkers.flavor: The best snipers strike from the most unexpected positions. Aranean Stalkers taught us to always scan the cliffsides, crevices, and skeletons of ruined buildings. If you spotted their glowing eye, you had a split second to hit the dirt. Sometimes you’d live. Sometimes they were just toying with you.
Aranean Stalkers.name: Aranean Stalkers

Arshem.description: Your own brother who has turned against you
Arshem.flavor: Your blood runs cold at his words. He speaks of slaughtering innocents, that any living Reaver could one day kill you both. You won't be part of this. You need to stop him, now.
Arshem.name: Arshem

Artificer's Laboratory.description: Special laboratory used to investigate the passing comet
Artificer's Laboratory.flavor:
The day you have been waiting for is nigh.

You watch your soldiers drag bodies to the site of your new lab. You ignore the sound of distant battle and focus on the limbs, organs, and machine parts before you.

In a short time, a passing comet vibrating with a unique harmonic signal will skip off the Earth's atmosphere. If you time it right, you will be able to direct that signal into a body formed of Acrin, Human, and fragments of ZEPHON.

Such a being could be the most powerful life form ever to walk planet Earth. No wonder then that other petty warlords stand ready to try and take it from you.

Let them come. All who threaten your work will perish.
Artificer's Laboratory.name: Artificer's Laboratory

Assault Troopers.description: Biological infantry with excellent armor, overchargable rifles and an iron will
Assault Troopers.flavor: Once our world was up and running again, we didn't have to rely on the Militants. We could train real blood-and-guts soldiers and develop gear for their specialized functions. These troopers were the first of them, better trained and equipped with transuranic plating and coilguns—what the kids in the playgrounds call Gauss Rifles.
Assault Troopers.name: Assault Troopers

Atlas Tank.description: Mechanical titan armed to the teeth with devastating weaponry and upgrades
Atlas Tank.flavor: Tanks like city blocks. They never made these before the fall. Something we found on a mil-server, buried in the design archive. You could strap all kinds of weapons to a vehicle that size. And on the battlefield, firing those guns was like a thunderous orchestra, with each section belching out a violent, earth-cracking score.
Atlas Tank.name: Atlas Tank

Bandit King.description: A bandit leader corrupted by the Philosopher's Stone
Bandit King.flavor: A light-haired man stumbles about the area, shrieking incomprehensibly at unseen tormentors. Brackish fluid weeps from his eyes and ears, more of it dribbles from his tongue whenever he speaks.
Bandit King.name: Bandit King

Bunker.description: Large mechanical fortification that protects an area and the units within
Bunker.flavor: Sometimes you take the fight to the enemy, and sometimes they come to you. We'd mostly survived the war in sub-surface bunkers but these defensive ones were different. They were cheaper and easier to build than tanks—but they made one hell of target.
Bunker.name: Bunker

Busters.description: Biological anti-armor infantry that can set enemies aflame
Busters.flavor: The Reavers refused to be left behind in an arms race. As we built stronger armor, they scavenged more powerful weapons to break through it. Some found a particular love for fire. They would strike our flanks like a blazing hot wind, lobbing incendiary grenades that melted our troops to the bone. They wanted us to know that until all of them were slaughtered, they would always be a threat.
Busters.name: Busters

Calem Vorshole.description: Leader of the Wicked Kings gang
Calem Vorshole.flavor: A report comes in that he fled to a Wicked Kings army hiding nearby. Better men have tried to destroy you… and failed. You welcome the challenge.
Calem Vorshole.name: Calem Vorshole

Chayot Exterminator.description: Large mechanical hover vehicle with good ranged capabilities and deployable combat drones
Chayot Exterminator.flavor: I fucking hated how these things talked. Bad enough that you had this massive insect hovering over your shoulder, but to hear how it spoke? Like a child voicing its first words, but never learning what came next. At least its drones kept quiet. If they all started talking together, I might have… well, I don't want to think about what I might have done.
Chayot Exterminator.name: Chayot Exterminator

Cherubim Titan.description: Mechanical titan flyer that blasts enemies with tachyon weaponry and grants damage reduction to allies
Cherubim Titan.flavor: These things were like–living thunderstorms. Their shields made the air smell like filtered ion. The sound of their cannons could start an avalanche. When such a behemoth took to the battlefield, you knew how the gods of the old waged war.
Cherubim Titan.name: Cherubim Titan

Combat Drones.description: Mechanical hover infantry with an assault rifle
Combat Drones.flavor: Did you know a combat drone could be used for psychological warfare? I learned the hard way. You would get cocky knocking them down by the dozen. It felt like we were tearing through hordes of machines. Then you’d hear the sound of your rifle clicking empty, and watch the drones fall back. That’s when the panic set in.
Combat Drones.name: Combat Drones

Combat Medics.description: Biological infantry that can heal and buff biological units
Combat Medics.flavor: Like the Engineers, our medics were make-dos, biologists, doctors, nurses, vets, chemists. Carried heavy shields so they could get close to the wounded for battlefield triage. Later, they had drones to help them out and implants, but at the start—at the start, they were just the bravest of the brave, heroes one and all.
Combat Medics.name: Combat Medics

Commander.description: Biological hero that fights well and supports infantry units in battle
Commander.flavor: We hoped that the Commanders were the best of us. They didn't skulk way behind the frontlines, they were out front, risking everything, talking to the refugees, fighting the horrors. Equipping them with exoskeletons improved their combat performance, but also did a hell of a lot for morale.
Commander.name: Commander

Cr'la Disciple.description: Biological infantry which are produced slowly, but ignore line of sight with their attacks and cast a variety of spells
Cr'la Disciple.flavor: So many people fell at the feet—too many damn feet—of the Cr'la Disciples. The creatures traveled far and wide to lure in desperate survivors with promises about the power of the Voice. Every poor soul they recruited became damned. The children of hell, desperate for the love of a dark father.
Cr'la Disciple.name: Cr'la Disciple

Crusader Battle Tank.description: Large mechanical vehicle with a versatile cannon, good armor and many upgrades
Crusader Battle Tank.flavor: Peak battle tanks, to fight the monsters. By the time we built these again, humanity was back on a sound footing—the tooling for these required more than the bodge jobs of the Outriders. But it was still definitely Soviet repair-it-with-a-hammer tech, not AI-guided stuff. This was all mechanical, motion-guided, from the cannon tip right down to rumbling treads.
Crusader Battle Tank.name: Crusader Battle Tank

Cyclone.description: Large mechanical anti-air vehicle with good armor and many upgrades
Cyclone.flavor: It was with dread that we realized our enemies would soon strike at us from above. Old world anti-air defenses wouldn’t do anything to stop them. So our engineers dug into the archives, and were able to optimize anti-air targeting for a mobile platform. They were finicky to operate though.
Cyclone.name: Cyclone

Dark Vassael.description: Large biological creature with a horrifying attack that reduces enemy morale
Dark Vassael.flavor: Not all who hear the Voice can comprehend it. Not all come back from the edge. Or not alone. Is it better to come back like this—a bag of aggregated human systems and minds—or not at all? What must it be like to be in there?
Dark Vassael.name: Dark Vassael

Deformities.description: Biological melee monsters that create Deformities by killing, but lose hitpoints each turn
Deformities.flavor: Every creature begins to die the second it draws breath. Deformities feel that sensation with every passing second. They’re bred to make bloodlines out of enemy corpses. When the killing stops, entire generations of these creatures will simply cease to exist.
Deformities.name: Deformities

Dreameater.description: Large hovering creature that reduces enemy morale and takes control of broken enemies
Dreameater.flavor: We called these things Dreameaters, but they really fed on our souls. They knew exactly where in the human brain was the fine line between chemicals and consciousness. If you drew close, they would grab you, rip open your skull, find that line… and drink in everything that made you truly alive.
Dreameater.name: Dreameater

Elect of Uzhodai.description: Large biological melee hero summoned to teleport across the battlefield and castigates enemies at the front lines
Elect of Uzhodai.flavor: These big brutal beasts freaked me the fuck out. Size of a tank. Arms that ended in blades. And what did they do when resting at HQ? Sit still, speaking in a dead language about deep philosophies of dimensional movement to Voice cultists sitting at their feet.
Elect of Uzhodai.name: Elect of Uzhodai

Elohim Maelstrom.description: Mechanical hover infantry with long range siege weapons that benefit from high ground
Elohim Maelstrom.flavor: Fortresses meant to stand for decades fell like sandcastles when these machines came to call. Their spines arched up and down with each shot fired. Troops who learned to time that arch and get to cover lived just a bit longer before the walls came falling down.
Elohim Maelstrom.name: Elohim Maelstrom

EMP Drones.description: Mechanical hover infantry that detonate themselves to stun mechanical units
EMP Drones.flavor: Combat Drones can be a distraction, but EMP Drones should be a high-priority target. You can’t kill the operator if one of these floating trash cans has knocked out all of your electronics. They’ll blow themselves up just to soften you up for the kill.
EMP Drones.name: EMP Drones

Engineers.description: Bio-mech infantry that found cities, construct roads, clear tiles as well as repair and buff mechanical units
Engineers.flavor: Some had formal training, most didn't. Scientists, construction workers, technicians. The thing that distinguished the people we called engineers from everyone else was that they had the skills to get the job done, whatever the job. The ones who hadn't…? Well, they weren't around anymore.
Engineers.name: Engineers

Erelim Assassin.description: Mechanical melee hero designed to sneak behind enemy lines and excel in close quarters combat
Erelim Assassin.flavor: We found ourselves in need of more subtle tools for waging war. In this new world, it wasn’t enough to just switch from bullets to knives, you needed assassins who could bend light itself around them too. I could only wonder—did these women think of themselves as still human? Or were they just an assembly of blades wearing human skin?
Erelim Assassin.name: Erelim Assassin

Exousia Marauder.description: Large mechanical hover transport from which units can disembark further
Exousia Marauder.flavor: Before the Acrin arrived, I swear I saw these on TV—giant hovercrafts used for rapid transport or salvaging oil rigs and broken-down tankers, I think. They're far from the sea now, though. I don't think they had a missile battery back then either…
Exousia Marauder.name: Exousia Marauder

Fallen Orolos.description: Large biological creature that blights melee attackers and fires a heavy long-range cannon that is more accurate when stationary
Fallen Orolos.flavor: The tongue. The teeth. The one eye that darted over your shoulder, searching for prey it could douse with its plague-ridden hellfire… I asked what kind of cultist would become a creature like this. None had. It had been grown from a cancerous tumor. A slow, expensive process that gave the disease all the flesh it wanted and a greater means than ever to spread itself across the land.
Fallen Orolos.name: Fallen Orolos

Hades Bomber.description: Mechanical flyer that dematerializes enemies with its antimatter bomb
Hades Bomber.flavor: Hades Bombers only took off once. It was expensive for them to take off and land repeatedly while carrying such earth-shattering payloads. Maintenance and crew cycling had to happen while it was airborne. They only came back down to earth in a very destructive blaze—and all that was left were these big, empty craters. They were so smooth—just like glass.
Hades Bomber.name: Hades Bomber

Hammerheads.description: Mechanical flyers tasked with capturing outposts and removing Bleed
Hammerheads.flavor: Hammerheads were powerful, if incoherent tools. Once provoked into combat, they’d pick a target and batter it repeatedly, with each blow more powerful than the last. Perversely, when at peace, these machines were like robotic gardeners—specialized in eradicating the Bleed of the Voice.
Hammerheads.name: Hammerheads

Hashmallim Host.description: Large mechanical hover vehicle that manipulates gravity to ignore cover, damage large units and affect the accuracy of allies and enemies
Hashmallim Host.flavor: Hashmallim Hosts were deployed with extensive support units. If they took too much damage, their circuitry could become exposed to the power of their Graviton Projectors. I never learned the exact details, but the message we were given was that messing with gravity messes with time, and time warping does hell for artificial intelligence.
Hashmallim Host.name: Hashmallim Host

Headquarters.flavor: Defending the heart of a city took a certain kind of grit. If you saw action while stationed here, there’d be no running. This job was for the stubborn and the stupid—those who’d rather die than lose pride in defeat.
Headquarters.name: Headquarters

Honorable Aristocrat (Engineer).description: A particularly slow Engineer that can only do one job
Honorable Aristocrat (Engineer).flavor: You're up for the task. It's one farm, how hard could it be?
Honorable Aristocrat (Engineer).name: Honorable Aristocrat (Engineer)

The NeoDuke's Brigade.flavor: This crew looks capable, but flawed. Surely they can handle one Warden…
The NeoDuke's Brigade.name: The NeoDuke's Brigade

Honorable Aristocrat (Outrider).flavor: You used to sneak out and steal the family car in the old days. This should be easy… right?
Honorable Aristocrat (Outrider).name: Honorable Aristocrat (Outrider)

Hwedo.description: Powerful bio-mech creature made with the energy of a passing comet
Hwedo.flavor:
It is done.

While your soldiers fought tooth and nail, you did the impossible. You tracked the approach of Hwedo's Comet, you activated key satellites in orbit, and you yanked the force out of that space-traversing rock and into your laboratory.

Across the wasteland, all eyes turned toward your lab and watched a magnificent bright light descend from the heavens—briefly splitting into parts before being absorbed by your array.

You race back to the main lab—and freeze right as you enter the chamber. Blood is spattered across the floor, and your lab technicians are all cowering in the corners. Your creation sits on the stone slab, examining the now fileted body of a slain scientist…

It tilts its head toward you, and says in a low tone “Hwedo. Hungers.”
Hwedo.name: Hwedo

IronFeather.description: IronFeather imprisoned in a special Malakim Destroyer
IronFeather.flavor: IronFeather wished to replace you. Now she will serve you. Forever.
IronFeather.name: IronFeather

Iok Swarm.description: Biological flyers that vomit acid and devour nearby units to heal themselves
Iok Swarm.flavor: Thought they were just bats at first. Weird, to see bats flying in the daytime. Then a bit of goop fell and hit my armor. Covered my entire shoulder and started burning like hell. Then the screeching hit my ears, and I knew we needed to start blasting.
Iok Swarm.name: Iok Swarm

Ishim Enforcers.description: Bio-mech infantry that alternate between high-power and low-power attacks while healing their wounds
Ishim Enforcers.flavor: A soldier’s broken body was just the foundation for a better weapon. Paralyzed? They shunted your spine. Missing limbs? They'd give you something better. Pretty soon they were standardizing the replacement parts and just outfitting the soldiers with them, whether they needed them or not.
Ishim Enforcers.name: Ishim Enforcers

Jezina.flavor: Jezina knows how to keep a low profile. The Chieftess nearly killed your messenger when they asked for details on her appearance. “She's a vicious monster who whips children. You'll know her when you see her” was her only response. Strange. You've never heard the Chieftess express worry for children before. What a… specific description.
Jezina.name: Jezina

Klot'Hadal.flavor: You race to the walls at the sound of a war horn—where a single Tattooed Hunter waits for you, atop an outsized Abkluth. She is called “Klot'Hadal,” after a mythical Acrin giantslayer. “You will bring me a Titan to slay,” she bellows. It's in your best interest to obey her command.
Klot'Hadal.name: Klot'Hadal

Kriteria Annihilators.description: Mechanical hover infantry that are more destructive after killing an enemy
Kriteria Annihilators.flavor: The branch of AI controlling the Annihilators was the only bloodthirsty machine we ever encountered. Once it landed a kill, all it craved was the next one. And the next one. And the one after that.
Kriteria Annihilators.name: Kriteria Annihilators

Krypt Archai.description: Large mechanical hovering hero that is hard to repair, but able to manipulate matter to protect allies and disable foes
Krypt Archai.flavor: The most unsettling thing you could learn about the Krypt Archai? The cube on its back had no power source. Where did all that energy come from? Was it out of the air? From space? Maybe it was reaching into another dimension, pulling chaos from that world to kill in ours.
Krypt Archai.name: Krypt Archai

Landan Graham.description: Bio-mech scientist that can clear tiles
Landan Graham.flavor: Landan Graham. Proof that the Watchmakers weren't all working toward the same goal. He was a scientist who sought power from stories—but far from the average idiosyncratic idiot you'd find in their ranks. Each time we crossed paths, I grew more and more sure he knew more about the Acrin than he was letting on about. You'd think he was born on their world…
Landan Graham.name: Landan Graham

Landan Graham (Augmented).description: Bio-mech scientist augmented with a magnificent weapon made of Human and Acrin technologies
Landan Graham (Augmented).flavor: Graham pulled something powerful out of that ship. As the final battle nears, he shows up on your doorstep, armed with a weapon none of your scientists recognize. It's a gauss pistol that purrs like a great cat, and firing it seems to give him a jolt of Acrin life force.
Landan Graham (Augmented).name: Landan Graham (Augmented)

Malakim Destroyers.description: Bio-mech hover infantry with powerful overheating weapons
Malakim Destroyers.flavor: Once you start aligning yourself with machines, you start to think like them. For me, the dead should be left dead. But our techs decided that's a waste of cheap organic processing power. Slice out those unneeded emotional centers, overcharge their mobility, wire them to a pair of big guns, and you had a monster that would have kept old world warriors up at night.
Malakim Destroyers.name: Malakim Destroyers

Militants.description: Basic infantry with faster fire rate at close range
Militants.flavor: Everyone who survived fought. Every one of us could have been a soldier. We called ourselves 'militants', though, because it reflected that we now fought for a purpose, political or social. The survival of mankind, whatever that took.
Militants.name: Militants

Missile Teams.description: Bio-mech anti-armor infantry that need to be stationary for accurate attacks
Missile Teams.flavor: Plenty of Militants were eager to pilot anti-armor bots far from the battlefield, but resentment grew quickly between the missile operators and front-line grunts. The solution? We docked rations every time the Missile Team pilots tripped their drones or missed a shot. It was better if they hated us—not each other.
Missile Teams.name: Missile Teams

Ophanim Carrier.description: Large mechanical flyer equipped to deploy numerous drones
Ophanim Carrier.flavor: The AI built this Carrier to specialize in killing at a distance, but equipped it with an arsenal of drones to fulfill other tactical purposes. If you spotted them in the dead of night, the drones wheeling around the body looked way too much like eyes.
Ophanim Carrier.name: Ophanim Carrier

Orin.flavor: Finally, the Voice's whispers guided you to a worthy servant: a slick-haired recluse who only gives you the name “Orin.” It seems Orin has spent years in the wastes conducting experiments that you might once have branded sacrilegious.
Orin.name: Orin

Outrider.description: Large mechanical transport with light equipment and excellent reconnaissance capabilities
Outrider.flavor: Ex-military fast transports, driven by militants. Never designed to go toe-to-toe with the new enemies of mankind. But then nothing was—artillery, nukes, carriers, all had failed. At least in an Outrider, you had a chance of getting away—that's why there were so many left.
Outrider.name: Outrider

Phenaris Epicurean.description: Biological melee infantry that temporarily boost their own hitpoints and heal allies when attacking enemies in melee
Phenaris Epicurean.flavor: Cultists transformed into Phenaris Epicurean kept their intelligence. No, that's not true. They became smarter. Poetic. You'd walk through the yard and see a group of them debating philosophy while picking apart the guts of prisoners dragged back to base. I think if the Voice's worshippers won the war… this would be the future of the human race.
Phenaris Epicurean.name: Phenaris Epicurean

Phenaris Hunters.description: Biological melee infantry that move in stealth, create nightmarish illusions and reveal enemies with their scythes
Phenaris Hunters.flavor: Nothing fucking right about how snakes writhe side to side and there's even LESS right about a human skull on a snake's spine bursting out of the shadows and goring the troops left out on watch. They picked their targets. They'd hit hard and fade back into the night. They looked like monsters, but they fought like contract killers from before the war.
Phenaris Hunters.name: Phenaris Hunters

Phoenix Interceptor.description: Large mechanical flyer capable of tremendous speed and excellent performance against other aerial targets
Phoenix Interceptor.flavor: Hotshots and knuckleheads still made for the best fighter pilots. When you went up in one of these, you needed to be ready to dance with another ace pilot, or play chicken with the jaws of a monster. A well-stocked Interceptor was ready for both.
Phoenix Interceptor.name: Phoenix Interceptor

Plangent Orolos.description: Large biological creature that manipulates sound to damage and immobilize enemies
Plangent Orolos.flavor: Cancer cells that formed Fallen Orolos could be shaped by sound waves. The creatures born from that process could hear whispers from the Voice no one else could—whispers that it turned into destructive weapons of its own, every blast a hellish sermon from a god that reshaped our world.
Plangent Orolos.name: Plangent Orolos

Praetorian.description: Biological infantry carrying antimatter equipment and jump packs to shock and devastate enemies in close combat
Praetorian.flavor: Soldiers equipped with Praetorian armor were prepared to slash open the veins of creatures three times their size. Or rip through the wiring of a machine that could tear open the world. We had to remind these troops that they were not gods-they were just trained in killing them.
Praetorian.name: Praetorian

Reaming Crodeus.description: Biological titan flyer that cripples and swallows foes only to digest them in its stomach
Reaming Crodeus.flavor: After these entered the battlefield, every village and town I visited was… quieter. Everyone stayed huddled indoors, terrified of a Crodeus dropping on their town and swallowing them whole. Peasants, scared of the dragon living up on the mountain…
Reaming Crodeus.name: Reaming Crodeus

Reavers.description: Biological poorly-armored infantry that go into a frenzy when surrounded
Reavers.flavor: Desperation drove some of our people to terrible ends. In what might have been humanity’s last hours, they traded theirs away for better odds of staying alive in the wasteland. Their bodies walked the earth, but the people inside them faded away with every passing day.
Reavers.name: Reavers

Reaver Camp.flavor: When all this is done, it will be you who kept him safe. A familial debt, decades old, will be repaid. Capture one camp, one single Reaver camp—and you can be truly reunited.
Reaver Camp.name: Reaver Camp

Repair Drones.description: Mechanical hover infantry that repair mechanical allies
Repair Drones.flavor: Don’t ignore these drones. Their field repairs made us wish humans were as easy to fix as machines. We joked about what you could get done if mending an arm was as simple as reconnecting some blasted circuitry. Some of us… some of us decided that wasn’t just a joke.
Repair Drones.name: Repair Drones

Sentries.description: Mechanical robots designed to guard an area
Sentries.flavor: ZEPHON wanted nothing to do with us. It could have just told us that directly. Instead it posted up Sentries that looked to be guarding something. We learned really quickly that they could hold a grudge. If you were the kind of grunt who liked to stomp ants because they couldn’t hit back, boy were these things a pain in the ass. More like an ant that would chew through your boot and try to take a few toes out before you put it down.
Sentries.name: Sentries

Seraphim Archangel.description: Mechanical hover titan that obliterates enemies with its singularity blade
Seraphim Archangel.flavor: The parallel processes driving this colossal machine spoke as one. Never with words, but with a melody that made your arteries vibrate. Maybe some creatures were tuned to hear the message it had to offer. Anything that couldn’t, faced obliteration.
Seraphim Archangel.name: Seraphim Archangel

Shoch'itris Lair.description: Large biological fortification that breeds Deformities
Shoch'itris Lair.flavor: You could never forget an encounter with a Shoch’itris. Their bellies were pits of death. Their skin was covered in pus-filled blisters, and the deformities that crawled out of them left you with nightmares. The truly deranged sought out the slick, moist sensation that came with embracing their tendrils.
Shoch'itris Lair.name: Shoch'itris Lair

Surthodai's Embrace.description: Large biological transport adept at traversing terrain and protecting units
Surthodai's Embrace.flavor: This… thing. It was bones, and limbs, and fingers—too many of all of them, towering over entire platoons. I thought this creature was another mass murdering monster, but it behaved like a twisted mother. The beast gathered soldiers into its arms for transport, caressed them like it cared for their well-being. It was a mockery of the human race.
Surthodai's Embrace.name: Surthodai's Embrace

TH-3 Corsair.description: Large flying mechanical transport skilled in evasive maneuvers
TH-3 Corsair.flavor: I never knew how this thing flew. I mean, it looked like a lump of melted plastic, a piece of clinker left after the fire had burned everything useful away. But then you saw it move in the air, swooping in to set down a platoon, before whirling away. And you reassessed—it had just been in the wrong element, on earth not air, like a fish out of water.
TH-3 Corsair.name: TH-3 Corsair

Tessera Core.description: Large mechanical hovering fortification engineered to manipulate gravity and act multiple times
Tessera Core.flavor: Hated the Hashmallim Hosts, but something about the defensive Cores they dropped was reassuring—they were easy to understand. Big object. Stayed in place. Defended what was on the other side of it. With a powerful gravity weapon. Simple and to the point, unlike every other overcomplicated clanker…
Tessera Core.name: Tessera Core

The False Speaker.flavor: The Archai is restored. Though its metal flesh is still battered, the cube on its back pulses to a far healthier beat. “Thank you, your holiness,” it says. “You and the Great Speaker have saved us.”
The False Speaker.name: The False Speaker

Valkyria.description: Large flying mechanical hero that relishes in the death of her enemies
Valkyria.flavor: Humanity’s first real weapon that could stand toe-to-toe with the monsters of the new world came with a price. We needed exosuits, but the scientists could only make them work if you hardwired a pilot into them. I thought no one would go for it, but some women in our group stood up. They were born ready to send their enemies to Valhalla.
Valkyria.name: Valkyria

Vanquisher Siege Tank.description: Large mechanical vehicle with an artillery cannon, good armor and many upgrades
Vanquisher Siege Tank.flavor: Troops hate the pilots. Pilots hate the troops. Both of them hate the artillery crews, like the ones on Vanquisher Siege Tanks. Those entitled SOBs sat miles away from the fight, so far that they couldn't hear the screams and gunfire. And if you pissed them off, their “miscalculation” meant friendly fire fucking up your trench.
Vanquisher Siege Tank.name: Vanquisher Siege Tank

Vorodai's Leviathan.description: Biological titan transport that excels at clearing large groups of enemies and draining their essence
Vorodai's Leviathan.flavor: They never cleaned the cage hanging from the Leviathan's belly. You could smell the mixture of stale blood from wounded troops and gooey pus dripping down. I always retched, but some… some were so far gone. The horrors just left them staring out dead-eyed into the distance, waiting for their end.
Vorodai's Leviathan.name: Vorodai's Leviathan

Vulkan R-5.description: Large mechanical mech that slams and incinerates its enemies
Vulkan R-5.flavor: Those early exoskeletons we gave to the Commanders—they were just prototypes. When our techs got going, the stuff they made… the R-5 was a terror machine, designed to survive long enough to get up close. Imagine launching every missile you had at this thing, seeing it vanish in a cloud of fire and smoke… only for it to burst out of the flames, undeterred and guns blazing.
Vulkan R-5.name: Vulkan R-5

Warden.description: Large mechanical robot that steals hitpoints from mechanical units and burns its victims alive
Warden.flavor: ZEPHON could have made any kind of machine and it made… this? Why would an all-powerful AI forge a machine that looked slapped together from spare parts? We were idiots. ZEPHON didn’t build a weapon, it made a weaponized, self-sustaining, autonomous pile of scrap. Living metal didn’t care if it was ugly as sin, it was just constantly calculating better ways to kill.
Warden.name: Warden

Warden (Augmented).flavor: The next day, a swarm of aerial drones drop off a silver-alloyed casket outside your city. The casket slides open with a hiss, revealing ZEPHON’s half of the bargain: a sleeker, upgraded Warden with carbyne-edge blades and an improved payload.
Warden (Augmented).name: Warden (Augmented)

Whisperer of Goldrauch.description: Biological hovering hero with ranged abilities to heal and summon allies as well as reveal and damage enemies
Whisperer of Goldrauch.flavor: There were rumors of a woman who bound her ears, covered her eyes, and… well, what she did to her skin… she wanted to feel nothing. Only the Voice. She was the closest any human came to understanding the Acrin. She wrapped their pain up in herself and carved out a new purpose. Don’t get in her way.
Whisperer of Goldrauch.name: Whisperer of Goldrauch

Zandra Kyne.description: A brilliant and slightly mad scientist that manipulates time
Zandra Kyne.flavor:
As the screech of the titans—both monster and machine—is heard across the wasteland, a portal opens in your command center and none other than Zandra Kyne falls out and crashes onto your war table.

She babbles something about breaking that table “every time” she reaches this moment before offering to fight by your side. “I have to be here,” she tells you. “Every time. I have to be here. Or it all just breaks.”
Zandra Kyne.name: Zandra Kyne

ZEPHON Black Site.flavor: One of your recon teams reports they found evidence of an underground ZEPHON black site. They ran a Crypt-Scan, hoping to find a server bunker or skunkworks, but instead the images returned a massive shielded hollow.
ZEPHON Black Site.name: ZEPHON Black Site

ZEPHON Titan.description: Mechanical titan that constructs Wardens, aids mechanical units and rains death and destruction on a large area
ZEPHON Titan.flavor: Sentries. Hammerheads. Wardens. ZEPHON always had this attachment to human machines—like it could look inside them and see the monsters that made them. Its Titan was a machine of deep anger, carved from the heart of a rusted battleship that once ferried death back and forth across the ocean.
ZEPHON Titan.name: ZEPHON Titan
